intro: Rubia cordifolia var. leiocaulis, commonly known as the smooth-stemmed madder, is a variant of the madder plant native to temperate regions of Europe and Asia. It is characterized by its slender, often glabrous stems and trifoliate leaves with heart-shaped leaflets. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers in terminal clusters, followed by dark red to black berries. Its roots contain anthraquinone compounds, which have been historically used in dyeing textiles and traditional medicine. This variety is valued for its ornamental appeal and historical significance in dye production.
